author: Page Publishing Media Department
title: Author Andrew Ritchie’s New Book, "Words of Hope," is a Collection of Reflections on Different Bible Verses That Will Inspire Hope, Love, and Encouragement - PR.com
text:
New York, NY, May 31, 2024 --( PR.com )-- Andrew Ritchie, who was born in Buckie, Scotland, has completed his new book, “Words of Hope”: an emotional, faith-based work written to inspire hope in readers.
Author Andrew Ritchie began writing in 2012, and this is his second published book. He has a BA (Hons) in theology. In 2020, at the height of the pandemic, during lockdown, he would go for his authorized walks. During that time, he would talk to people from a safe distance, and they would share their fears and hopes. Three years later, the pandemic is over, but the fear is very noticeable due to the cost-of-living crisis.
Ritchie writes, “Over the last several days, we have been looking at the seven churches of Revelation but through a different interpretation. We have been exploring them as they are human conditions of the heart. The final one is the faithful heart. Could this be the heart that is described in 1 Samuel 13:14 when the kingdom was removed from Saul? King David is often described as the man after God’s own heart.”
Published by Page Publishing, Andrew Ritchie’s remarkable work is rooted in the true meaning of scripture.
Readers who wish to experience this meaningful work can purchase “Words of Hope” at bookstores everywhere, or online at the Apple iTunes Store, Amazon, Google Play, or Barnes and Noble.
For additional information or media inquiries, contact Page Publishing at 866-315-2708.
About Page Publishing:
Page Publishing is a traditional, full-service publishing house that handles all the intricacies involved in publishing its authors’ books, including distribution in the world’s largest retail outlets and royalty generation. Page Publishing knows that authors need to be free to create, not mired in logistics like eBook conversion, establishing wholesale accounts, insurance, shipping, taxes, and so on. Page’s accomplished writers and publishing professionals allow authors to leave behind these complex and time-consuming issues and focus on their passion: writing and creating. Learn more at www.pagepublishing.com.

author: @Metropoles
title: Saiba qual será o nome da segunda filha de Neymar com Bruna Biancardi
text:
Saiba qual será o nome da segunda filha de Neymar com Bruna Biancardi
Bruna Biancardi e Neymar revelaram que estão à espera de uma menina nesta quinta-feira (26/12). Essa é a sua segunda filha do casal
atualizado
Compartilhar notícia
[Google News - Metrópoles](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqBwgKMPfq-gowsr7yAg?hl=pt-BR&gl=BR&ceid=BR%3Apt-419)
[Bruna Biancardi](https://www.metropoles.com/tag/Bruna-Biancardi) e [Neymar](https://www.instagram.com/neymarjr/) estão esperando a segunda filha juntos — o casal já tem Mavie, de um ano. Após o fim do chá revelação, ocorrido na última quarta-feira (25/12), amigos e convidados do evento desconfiam que o [jogador e a influencer](https://www.metropoles.com/colunas/fabia-oliveira/descubra-o-sexo-do-segundo-filho-de-neymar-e-bruna-biancardi) já teriam escolhido o nome da herdeira.
Fontes do Portal LeoDias informaram que suspeita que o casal já tenha chegado a um consenso do nome da futura filha e que ela se chamará Mel. Bruna Biancardi teria feito a sugestão ao craque da Seleção Brasileira e ele acatado a decisão. Entretanto, o casal ainda não compartilhou a informação ao público.
Vale lembrar que Neymar Jr. é pai de Davi Lucca, de 13 anos, fruto do relacionamento com Carol Dantas, Mavie, de 1, de Bruna Biancardi, e Helena, de 5 meses, filha de Amanda Kimberlly.
No Instagram, o casal compartilhou um vídeo em que mostrava Mavie brincando com a barriga de Biancardi, além de imagens do chá-revelação, que contou com as ajudas de Davi Lucca, responsável por apertar o botão que anunciou a chegada de uma menina, e a caçula dos pombinhos.
Ver essa foto no Instagram

author: Juan Castro
title: Mal estado en el entorno del muelle Santa Catalina
text:
[](/) []https://micuenta.laprovincia.es/tp/login []https://micuenta.laprovincia.es/tp/perfil [](/)
Ver más galerías relacionadas
Juan Castro
El frente marítimo entre el Puerto de La Luz y la Base Naval, a donde este enero llegan los mismísimos Reyes Magos,
necesita cariño. Solo hay que darse una vuelta rápida por el muelle y el parque de Santa Catalina para contemplar la ausencia de mantenimiento o la dejadez en algunas infraestructuras, sobre todo las que están más cerca del mar y dan la bienvenida a los turistas de los cruceros, un sector que ahora está en plena temporada alta y llena de ambiente esa parte de la ciudad.

author: VNExplorer
title: Abbott ordena a hospitales públicos de Texas recopilar información sobre inmigrantes indocumentados
text: AUSTIN, Texas — El gobernador Greg Abbott emitió el jueves una orden ejecutiva que exige a los hospitales públicos de Texas recopilar información sobre los inmigrantes indocumentados que reciben atención médica, incluyendo el costo de dicha atención, con el objetivo de que el gobierno federal cubra esos gastos. En un comunicado, Abbott explicó que tomó esta medida debido a lo que denominó como las "políticas de frontera abierta" del presidente Joe Biden y la vicepresidenta Kamala Harris. Abbott afirmó que el estado luchará para que el gobierno federal pague los costos médicos asociados con el tratamiento de inmigrantes indocumentados. La Comisión de Salud y Servicios Humanos de Texas (HHSC, por sus siglas en inglés) instruirá a los hospitales y otros proveedores identificados a recopilar información sobre el costo de la atención médica brindada a inmigrantes indocumentados, a partir del 1 de noviembre. También se les indicará a los hospitales que envíen estos datos a la HHSC trimestralmente, con los primeros informes programados para el 1 de marzo de 2025. Además, los hospitales deberán informar a los pacientes que, por ley federal, cualquier respuesta a estas preguntas no afectará la atención que reciban. A partir del 1 de enero de 2026, la HHSC informará anualmente al gobernador, al vicegobernador y al presidente de la Cámara de Representantes sobre los costos del año anterior relacionados con la atención médica proporcionada a inmigrantes indocumentados. La orden se aplica a los hospitales inscritos en Medicaid o en el Programa de Seguro Médico para Niños, así como a cualquier otro identificado por la HHSC. KHOU 11 se ha puesto en contacto con hospitales locales para averiguar si cumplirán con la orden, así como con la oficina del gobernador y los Servicios de Salud y Humanos de Texas para obtener comentarios.

author: Melanie Falcon
title: Health Beat: Robotic puppies and the therapeutic benefits | Health Beat | wfmz.com
text:
A recent peer reviewed study indicates that children who spend time with therapy dogs can lower their stress even more than with relaxation exercises.
That outcome becomes even more important when the child is in the hospital. But what happens when there are not enough therapy dogs?
Meet Otis, Max and Stride.
Seven-year-old Josh Summitt misses walking his dogs during his stay in the hospital. So, Stanford Children’s Health introduced him to the next best thing.
“I kinda felt a little bit nervous to meet the dogs. But after I met them, they were very, very friendly,” Josh said.
The robotic dogs, known as Max, Otis and Stride, are Stanford’s way of curbing the anxiety felt by their young patients.
The endeavor is a collaboration between the university’s robotic students and the hospital’s Chariot Program, which seeks out innovations that can help patients.
“A lot of robotics technologies get developed in a lab and never have any real impact on the world. But we can see immediately the impact, cheering these kids up,” said Stanford engineering student Gabriel Levine.
While therapy animals have long been known to help reduce pain, anxiety and depression, doctors are encouraged that the robotic dogs are already showing some of the same benefits.
"It’s amazing. They’re so joyful. I think that having these robotic puppies be a part of our team has allowed us to engage them in a way that was not possible before,” said Dr. Ellen Wang , co-director of the Chariot Program.
“We've had experiences in the past where a patient enjoyed hanging out with the robot so much, he almost forgot he was going to surgery, and that’s really powerful,” added Dr. Teresa Nguyen , anesthesiologist at Stanford Children’s Health.
Josh’s mom, Amelia Summitt, has also seen a difference.
“And it's really sparked his curiosity. He can still be seven and be excited and play,” she said.
Stanford Children’s Health is just completing its pilot phase with the robots, and based upon the popular response, this is only the beginning.
The Stanford students are now developing a new version of the robot dog that promises to be even more agile than before.

author: ur_quan_master
title: #26 Belén "blasfemo" con personas del mismo sexo indigna a los conservadores italianos
text:
[gelatti](/user/gelatti)a [es.investing.com](/go/link/3890231)
Puedo entender que les moleste por "romper la tradición" a mi también me molesta cuando le quitan la barba a un personaje de comic que la lleva.
Ahora, que les moleste porque sea del mismo sexo,,, recordemos que a esta mujer le preño una paloma y vamos a tirarnos ahora de los pelos porque esté con una mujer?
[#4](c4#c-4) Eso explicaría de forma que todo el mundo pueda entender como María llegó virgen a su cita con la paloma pese a estar casada.
[#4](c4#c-4) mira que podía haber optado por convertir a los reyes en gays, o hacer una carroza del orgullo con los pastorcillos, pero poner dos vírgenes María es un sinsentido. Respeta lo básico del Belén y a partir de ahí añade lo que quieras, no te pases tomando licencias que luego queda irreconocible.
[#18](c18#c-18) pues está dentro de la tradición. Si en el belén había un buey, ¿por qué no unas boyeras?
Dicho con todo el respeto hacia las lesbianas y el resto de personas que solo quieren ejercer su libertad sexual sin que venga ningún cura a meter el hocico.
[#2](c2#c-2) Ojalá algún día se pueda extraer energía de la subnormalidad y la estupidez. Conquistariamos el universo.
[#24](c24#c-24) pero es que quizás no es cuestión de comprensión lectora, si no de capacidad redactora.
O quizás será bueno que en vez de dar una vuelta a las cosas dijeras claramente lo que quieres decír.
A mi que vengas con rodeos sobre que si el islam se debe enseñar por que la otra se enseña, pero eh, que a mi no me gusta... Me dice que no sabes ni lo que hablas.
A mi me la pela. Esta bien lo de defender la libertad de expresión y la libertad para creer o no creer.
Tus creencias para ti y yo en un país libre haré lo que quiera.
Pero luego vemos la otra cara de la moneda.
Que si una diputada de podemos dice que el islam es el feminismo e invento la seguridad social.
https://www.google.com/amp/s/amp.antena3.com/noticias/espana/polemicas-declaraciones-nora-banos-candidata-podemos-islam-feminista-invento-seguridad-social_202002245e53d5a00cf2a8ef178bab57.html
Público, el periódico que izquierdas llamando la atención por que no se enseña suficiente islam en las escuelas.
https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.publico.es/sociedad/asignatura-religion-islamica-colegios-espana-alumnos-musulmanes.html/amp
Se puede reivindicar con el belen, pero hay que retirar cerdo para no ofender a los musulmanes.
https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.elespanol.com/espana/20230626/cup-exige-retirar-alimentos-cerdo-fiestas-cataluna-respeto-musulmanes/774422768_0.amp.html
Muy buena esta libertad.
[#12](c12#c-12) Lo que tú no entiendes es que si metes en el juego las creencias de unos no puedes sacar las de otros. Y para que no se ofendan los capillitas somos capaces de comer por todos lados. Yo estoy COMPLETAMENTE EN CONTRA de que haya CUALQUIER religión en educación, sanidad o en el ejercicio, pero por otro lado, entiendo que si esta presente una, los demás pidan lo propio.
Se nos olvida que la iglesia se lleva un buen pico por dar "ese servicio" no solo en colegios
[#17](c17#c-17) tu comentario esta mal desarrollado y carece de sentido.
Estas "COMPLETAMENTE EN CONTRA de que haya CUALQUIER religión en educación, sanidad o en el ejército " pero por otro lado "entiendo que si esta presente una, los demás pidan lo propio."
No ves falta de lógica en tu argumento? Estas en contra y al mismo tiempo a favor.
[#19](c19#c-19) No, estoy encontra de que paguemos el profe de religión en los coles, el mantenimiento de capilla en universidades, hospitales y cuarteles (con su correspondiente cura). Y hablamos de religión catolica.
Ahora bien, ENTIENDO, que si hay prevendas para unos, los otros (llamese musulmanes, testigos de Jehova o san pitopato), estén en su derecho de recibir las mismas.
No tienes ningún tipo de comprensión lectora.
[#20](c20#c-20) ahora ya te voy entendiendo mejor.
Básicamente, ahora lo que me dices es que no al catolicismo, pero como esta el catolicismo, entonces las demás también.
Podrías haber dicho, quitemos el catolicismo y no dejemos pasar el resto de religiones, pero.... Si hay una todas las demás también. Y sin embargo dices que estás en contra.
Lo lógico sería decir que estás en contra del catolicismo y a favor de toda las demás.
Que no se enteren los de vox que en el Belén de Vilavenut también hay dos madres haciendo de Maria y José.
https://www.ccma.cat/324/el-pessebre-vivent-de-vilavenut-enguany-amb-dues-mares-de-deu-i-sense-sant-josep/noticia/3268061/

author: Glamour
title: Ashley Benson Steps Out in a Crop Top After Welcoming Her First Baby – DNyuz
text:
Ashley Benson is out and about after welcoming her first child with husband Brandon Davis .
On February 29, the 34-year-old actor confirmed the happy news by posting a photo of her newborn’s hand gripping her finger on her Instagram Story with a simple pink heart emoji. So far, she has not revealed any further information, including the baby’s name, birthday, or gender.
Just a day earlier, the Pretty Little Liars alum was spotted in a Los Angeles parking lot with Davis, a 45-year-old socialite and grandson of a billionaire oil tycoon. Benson first announced their engagement on Instagram Stories in July 2023 after less than a year of dating. According to People , they wed sometime before the start of 2024.
In the new pic from February 28, she can be seen wearing a black bra top layered under an open green and white striped cropped button up. Benson finished off the casual look with a pair of sweatpants, flip-flops, and skinny black sunglasses. As for her hair, Benson is rocking a chic brunette bob, which she debuted on Instagram in February.
Clearly, Ashley Benson is not one for big announcements. She first confirmed the pregnancy back in November by simply showing up to the Babylist showroom in Beverly Hills with her then-fiancé. At the time, Benson appeared perfectly aware and unbothered that she was being photographed and recorded, presumably agreeing to appear in a baby registry shopping video for the brand’s Instagram account. Instagram content
This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.
A few months later, Benson posed for a topless maternity shoot for the cover of Ladygunn magazine and revealed why she opted to stay quiet at the beginning of her pregnancy journey. “I kept private because being so seen by everyone else, everyone has an opinion,” she said in the interview, which was published in late January. “It’s very lonely and you just feel judged. It’s really hard.”
However, the actor hinted that she was preparing to step back into the spotlight, telling the publication, “And with the birth of my child, the rebirth of my career is going to happen too.” Let’s go!
The post Ashley Benson Steps Out in a Crop Top After Welcoming Her First Baby appeared first on Glamour .

author: Rose Schmidt
title: How much Minnesotans are saving on heating during warmer winter
text:
MINNEAPOLIS (FOX 9) - After one of the warmest Decembers on record in the Twin Cities, Minnesotans may like what they see when their utility bills arrive.
A spokesperson for Xcel Energy said heating bills in Minnesota have been lower because of the above-average temperatures . Also, because wholesale natural gas prices are significantly lower now than last winter, the company had estimated that the average Minnesota customer would see their bill decrease about 15% this year. The average bill would be $127.53, down from $149.49, or an average of $22. That figure doesn't even account for how warm December has been.
FOX 9 also spoke with Joshua Solis, lead communications specialist from CenterPoint Energy , Minnesota's largest natural gas utility. He does want to caution customers that it is still early in the heating season.
"With the warmer temperatures, customers have not necessarily needed to use as much gas earlier this season," Solis said. "I think our overarching thing we want to remind customers of is that there are colder days ahead and the temperatures are going to drop."
When the temperatures do start to drop, here are a few tips to save money, according to Xcel Energy:
Keep the blinds open during the day to let the sunlight in, and keep them closed at night to keep the cold air out. During winter months, set the thermostat between 65-70 degrees while you're home, and 58 degrees when you're away. A programmable thermostat automatically adjusts the temperature based on your routine and could help you save on heating costs. Run ceiling fans clockwise. Avoid opening the oven while cooking to keep the heat inside. Make sure exterior doors are fully closed. Keep furnace filters clean because dirty furnace filters reduce airflow, requiring the furnace to work harder and use more energy. Change the filter once a month during the winter to reduce your heating costs by between 5-15%. Don't let the heat escape: Affordable window sealing kits can be found in most local home improvement stores. Improve the insulation of walls, crawl spaces, floors and heating ducts in a home. Lower the water heater's temperature or insulate it: The proper temperature for a water heater is 120 degrees, and by lowering it 10 degrees, a household can save between 3-5% on water heating costs. It can also be insulated to maximize efficiency.
